likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the Delayed Transition scenario, the increased occurrence of extreme weather events due to a 2.5°C temperature rise and moderate policy stringency is likely to lead to a higher likelihood of supply chain disruptions and production delays for the iPhone Division. Both the likelihood and impact of this risk are expected to increase as extreme weather can affect manufacturing facilities and logistics.

emerging_opportunities.description: Develop products that integrate climate resilience features, such as enhanced durability and performance in extreme weather conditions.
Opportunity to invest in and promote a more sustainable supply chain, potentially attracting environmentally conscious consumers.

additional_challenges.description: Increased frequency of extreme weather events may disrupt logistics and manufacturing, leading to delays in product availability.
The need to adapt facilities and supply chains to withstand extreme weather may lead to increased operational costs.

mitigation_strategies.description: Expand supplier base and diversify geographic locations to reduce dependency on any single region prone to extreme weather events.
Upgrade facilities and logistics networks to be more resilient against extreme weather impacts, ensuring continuity of operations.
Utilize AI and data analytics to better predict extreme weather events and plan accordingly for potential disruptions.
